hyysguyang wrote:
> Hi��
>    I read this discussion over and over again this days.In fact ,I
> think the real problem is that the ability of my refactor.
> Yesterday I start a discussion with my colleague,He think that there
> isn't duplication between the two strings and only the duplicated code
> in product is considered  as duplication.After careful consideration,
> I agree with he said.I think the string in test is the input data,we
> shouldn't concern about the relationship in test and the implement of
> product method. Only the duplication in product code should be
> refactor.Do you think so��

I think that duplication between test production code *is* a smell - if 
perhaps not an as strong one. When I seen duplication such as in your 
example, I would still think a while about why it's there and how I 
could get rid of it - and most often that will lead to some insights and 
an improved design, in my experience.

Hope this helps,

Ilja
